landing.intro:
At LearnGraph we're co-creating the education system of tomorrow - Join our <linktodiscord>Comunity of Practice</linktodiscord>!
This is a prototype that implements a simple way to crowd-source learning-paths, by asking you to create and vote on learning-dependncies you've encountered.
The result is a geographical map of learning dependencies, where we will soon implement path finding (curriculum creation), zooming (detail reduction, like on google maps) and ad-hoc community formation based on the current learning-path you're on to connect you with peers on your personalized learning-journey!
landing.missionStatementText: Co-creating the future of education - free for everyone. We enable people to learn, independent of their situation in life and the resources at their disposal. Read our whitepaper here.
landing.crowdsourcingExplanation:
The Learn Graph collects votes from learners and educators about the dependency of knowledge on other knowledge. This creates a network of dependencies, a weighted, directed graph, which anyone can navigate just like a landmap to form a personalized curriculum.
We choose an open knowledge approach by linking only to OER (Open Educational Resources), everyone gets full non-commercial access to the LearnGraph for free. There will never be a paywall between you and your learning-journey.
landing.crowdsourcingCallToAction: That means users like you build this knowledge base, and everyone benefits from it. Contribute your knowledge today, by voting on existing connections or creating new subjects and dependencies!

highlights.independentFromEducationalInstitutions: You are independent of educational institutions!
highlights.controlOfYourLearningPath: You're in control of your learning path, and you can choose every step of your learning path.
highlights.accessibleLowEntryBarrier: Learngraph.org is available — it has an extremely low entry barrier!
highlights.noAttendanceExamsFees: 不收學費、沒有點名、不用考試！
highlights.youControlHowMuchWhenAndHow: 自己決定學多快、學多久、學多少。
highlights.openAndEasyStart: 按下註冊，立即享受學習的樂趣。

qnas.aFreeAndOSMoneyTbd: 完全免費，而且完全開源！原始碼放在<linktogithub>我們的 Github 頁面</linktogithub>。
qnas.qDiffToConventionalLearningPlatforms: 和現有的網路學習平臺相比，LearnGraph 有哪些特點？
qnas.aNoContentHosting: We do not host content ourselves, instead we provide you three tools: One a path to your goal, together with an overview to make decisions about your personal curriculum. Two a community of learners to connect with on your learning-journey. And three immediate access to Open Educational Resources (OER) content in the internet.
qnas.qProjectVision: LearnGraph 想要達成什麼目標？
qnas.aLearningEcosystem: Co-creating a learning ecosystem. We believe that education and cooperation are the keys to a better world.

about.aboutLG-para: LearnGraph is an innovative educational platform developed by a diverse team with expertise in education, technology, and global partnerships. Our mission is to democratize education by providing a personalized, accessible, and user-driven learning experience. LearnGraph empowers learners to create their own educational paths, offering high-quality resources without the limitations of traditional systems. By leveraging crowdsourced learning dependencies and connecting learners with peers and mentors, the platform continuously evolves to meet the needs of today’s dynamic educational landscape.
about.missionp: Co-creating the future of education - free for everyone.We enable people to learn, independent of their situation in life and the resources at their disposal.
about.Storyp: Here lies the story of our creation which started with two freinds just bouncing ideas off eachother, trying to find out how they fit into this world, fixing a system that annoyed them.
about.aboutLG-team: Our team brings together specialists in educational strategy, UX/UI design, and software development. With a focus on accessibility, diversity, and inclusion, LearnGraph ensures that learners from all backgrounds can benefit from personalized learning journeys. We are committed to fostering a global community of learners and educators, enabling meaningful connections, and making quality education accessible to everyone, regardless of geographical or financial barriers.
about.Our-Team-text: Vibe with the current members of our team
about.team-Efecan: Head of Educational Strategy and Innovation
about.quote-Laurin: Constantly nurturing the sapling me and my team planted and eventually we will all see it turn into the most majestic tree
about.quote-Nama: The world is a really big place and there are people that have been privilleged with resources, it's the duty of those people to help the ones without
about.quote-Efecan: My love for learngraph originates from my profession as an instructor, I love working on new ways of nurturing the newer generations
about.quote-Talal: It's scary out there, but we were never meant to be alone. Whats important isn't what I can do for me its what everyone can do for the human race
about.team-placeholder-description: We are always on the lookout for passionate individuals eager to contribute to our mission of transforming education. Whether you're a software developer, an education enthusiast, or someone with unique skills to bring to the table, there’s a place for you at LearnGraph. Join us in shaping the future of accessible, personalized learning and be part of a global community dedicated to making quality education available to everyone.

howto.headline-footerp3: ! All data you insert is only saved locally in your browser.
howto.subh-1-footerp1: Are you unsure what topics are appropriate? See our
howto.para-1: The LearnGraph is a map of learning dependencies. In this image, you can see that in order to understand multiplication, you need to learn about addition. There is no way around learning addition first, so the connection between them is strong. The arrow always points you towards the things you have to learn to understand a given topic. Clicking on a topic reveals learning resources and information about the most important learning dependencies.
howto.para-3-bullet2: icon to switch between edit and view-only mode.
howto.para-3-bullet3: Search for subjects using the search bar.
howto.para-3-bullet4: Click on any topic (in edit mode) to reveal learning resources.
howto.para-3-bullet7: icon lets you switch between edit and read-only mode. Move the subject toward its prerequisite knowledge to create a new link. Alternatively, use the
howto.para-3-bullet9: "New dependency" dialogue. Select an existing link to vote on the strength of the connection. To add a new topic, use the
howto.para-4: You may find some subjects in a different language than your selected one. They are marked by the corresponding country flag. You can translate subjects to your selected language by editing the subject and removing the flag icon. To insert a translation in a different language than your currently selected one, first change your language settings and then proceed with the translation.
howto.para-5: Some topics are more connected than others. These might be more important to learn about. The zoom slider on the right-hand side groups areas of knowledge under the banner of the topic that is required the most, i.e., has the highest number of arrows pointing toward it.
